text: Can at Sorbon. Golden with a white head. Quite light with hops, bread, citrus and hints of yeast. An easy to drink one.

I have to say I was extremely surprised that I actually enjoyed this beer. Lagers with high ABV always taste too alcoholic, but this one is an exception. Very tasty and they managed to hide the faulty tastes with nice hopping, very nice!

330ml can
Pale straw color with huge head.
Aroma is light fruity hop - lemon/lime plus yeasty and slight cooked vegetable sulfur.
Mild bitterness with light hop palate and dry finish.
OK.
This is what I'm looking for in a lager.....75 chars............................................. via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pale straw color with a taller, lasting, white head. Aroma is heavier with hops, with tropical fruit of pineapple and mango. Hints of citrus and pine. Mild pale malt backdrop. Light and lively feel. Flavors are subtle and light. Sweetness seems to go from start to finish with light malt and juicy hops. Finish returns to light sweet malt, while linger dries up and has a near woody bitterness. A hot summer night on the deck type brew. Quite enjoyable.

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2017 23.03.2017, 0,65l bottle shared with friends @ local tasting:
Big fizzy-creamy longlasting head, slightly hazy golden color. Aroma is mild grainy, worth, wet hay, flowers, grass, minerals, yeast, cereal. Taste is harsh mineraly, weeds, worth, minerals, wet hay, paper, cereal, bark, yeast, flowers. Medium bitterness, harsh boozy mouthfeel. Crap!

650ml hazy yellow 15mm white head that laces the glass and remains to the end. Quite carbonated, never ending tiny bubbles re charge that head. Light grainy malt and pleasant tropical fruity hops together with the clean yeast just work a treat. Remarkably easy to drink this one considering the fairly high ABV of 6.7%. Classy new style Pilsner.
En lager i den nya skolan med mer släktskap med en ipa en en klassisk lager. Funkar!

Can. Cloudy straw colour with frothy white head that quickly dissipates. Tropical fruit bomb aroma, with a touch of grass and background malt. The flavour profile belies the aroma, with a spicy, dry and bitter front palate. There's a touch of passionfruit towards the finish and a small amount of malt adds some balance. The champagne yeast is indiscernible and the spicy, bitter hops overpower. The heavy ABV rears its head towards the end of the glass. Over carbonated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber from Whole Foods Santa Barbara . One of the the best imperial pils I have had. Full bodied flavor yet reasonably crisp. Not too cloying like many imperial pils. I was concerned it
Would not travel well from New Zealand - no bottled on date, only some obscure numbering on bottom of bottle. But the
Beer tasted fresh and had a great flavor. Recommended

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Semi hazy blonde yellow beer with a large white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of citrus, grapefruit, pine needles, gooseberries and herbs. Flavor is spicy with notes of citrus, pine needles, yeast, gooseberries and grass.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of malt, light fruit, light citrus. Taste is fresh, fruity and crisp with a mellow bitterness and a lingering fruit sweet finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.

Boks 330ml fra Systembolaget Luleå - Storheden. Delt med Rune på Nerstranda 9 Sep 16. Gyldengulgrønnbrun. Kremaktig skum med filigranser. Lett fruktaroma. Tropisk. Myk munnfølelse. Smaken søt frukt. Mest mango. Lett syrlig ettersmak.
On draft. Clear yellow pour, with a white head. Hoppy, tropical fruit, grass, melon, grain, cracker, and dry. Pretty nice drinking beer.

Can 33 cl. Pours yellow with a slight haze and a white head. Grassy hops on a clean malt background. Medium-bodied, very grassy, slightly sulphurous with a rather bitter finish. A little rough around the edges with very limited aromatic qualities. 281116
Can sampled at Älvsjö fair. Small and lingering white lace. Clowdy pale yellow color. Sulphur aroma with fresh grapes. Sparkling and fresh.
Overall: Sweet bread, mellow orange notes. Smooth.Note: Can 330 ml at home. Reviewed 2016-10-22.
Sample from the bottle at Olutexpo 2016, Helsinki. Colour is slightly cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Fruits, citrus, some sweetness and malts.

Draught @ OlutExpo 2016. Pours yellowish with a smooth head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, hay and grass. Taste is smooth, sweetish and grassy with some hay and citrus. Finish is crisp, grassy and herbal with some hay and citrus. Okay, but doesnt feel very fresh.

Can @ home. Slightly hazy straw color. Dry aroma with gooseberries, white grape, hay, pine Apple, toast. Nicely Balanced. Taste has some sweet malts and bread. Solid bitterness. Notes of white grape, grapefruit, yeast and lemon zest.

Into a chalice at just on chilled. Misty, pastel yellow with intermittent, fine carbonation and a sloppy, messy white crown that yields some good legs - not quite the lively Champagne I anticipated. Nose is weedy with a burst of DMS boiled cabbage and urinal cake that is hard to shake off. Underneath is notes of Kiwi-fruit, under-ripe melon and bitter gourd, lychee and lemon sherbet that tickles the olfactories. Soft on the palate - again unexpected - and bitter as all hell. Lasting, weedy and grassy bitter swallow. Too much length, stays well past its due. Dusty, powdery malt profile. Very dry, parching. The dank notes of the aroma playing onto the palate making it all seem unclean and clumsy. Body is featherweight with the alcohol peeking through the weeds to give it warmth. A little candied fruit also peeks out giving it a tangy, vinous quality. Seems disjointed and drabby, and lacking balance and poise. One for the ol re-rate bin! (33cL, BB 14/12/16, The Liquor Shed, Jandakot)

Fruity aroma with bit of kiwi and gooseberries. The bitterness is not a nice bitterness and feels misplaced. There is also a faint tartness that doesnt fit the style. Could have been more carbonated.

Pour is golden yellow with thin white head and fine bubbles. The aroma is faint tropical fruits, flavour is slightly sweet fruity with very full mouthfeel. long bitter finish. The Nelson Sauvin hops are very prominent.
330ml can. Golden body with a medium white head. Some bread, tropical fruits and citrus.

330ml can shared by Finn. Solid lacing from decent white head. Next to clear yellow-gold body. Tropical fruity smell with mid-sweet malts in the back. Grapefruit flavours added by pale malts. Mid-dry bitter ending. Medium bodied. Refreshing and easy to drink (Tromsø 09.09.2016).
Draft. Pours slightly hazed gold with a white head. Niiiice spicy and floral hop bitterness, clean pale grains, and a quick zippy finish. Dope.
33 cl från systembolaget. En riktigt trevlig ale. Kanske den bästa av de i fyrpacket från Garage project.

September 23, 2015. On tap at Brewdog Kungsholmen. 
Clear pale golden with a small white head. Aroma is sweet malty and grainy with fruity and floral hoppy notes of gooseberries, grapes and citrus. Taste is sweet, malty and light bitter. Finish is light bitter with some grass and hay notes, grainy sweetness, notes of earthy herbs and some fruity notes of grapes and gooseberries. Light to medium bodied, average carbonation.
How : can Appearance : clear golden with a medium white head. Aroma : grass, grapefruit cest, peach and some hints of herbs. Palate : medium body, average carbonation.
Bottle. Pours a bright gold colour with a firm white head, aroma is light and hoppy, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.
Can from a sampler pack i bought at systembolaget (0,33l) - Fruity, slight citrus and herbal aromas. Finish does not last long. Okay.
Pours clear golden. Aroma is fruity, sharp, citrus. Lots of hops. Taste is fruity, citrus, nice amount of hops. Beautiful balance.

Can. Pours a slightly hazy pale yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grainy hoppy grassy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy peachy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty peachy grassy grainy finish.
Ljusgul, disig med stort skum. Fruktig doft med tropiska söta frukter. Stor fruktig smak med tropiska frukter, fruktsötma avbryts av en baöanserad beska.

En riktigt god lager, jag diggar verkligen Nelson S. Mycket smak men hade önskat lite mer beska. Söt, fruktig, bröd, malt, krispig, gräs. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
@ Basunen 16-7-8: Frisk och humlig och på så sätt trevlig. Ganska enkel och inte mycket pilsnerstuk över den. Mer pale ale.
Can from Systembolaget. Pale, clear yellow with mid-sized white head. Dry aroma with grass, pepper, grapes. Similar dry taste with grapes, grass, citrus. A little bit sweet finish. Nice overall.
Bärnstensfärgad grumlig med stort vit skum. Doftar och smakar nelson humle och ganska torr eftersmak

Burk från SB, Garage Project mixpack. Blekgul klar vätska med bubbligt vitt skum. Söt, fruktig doft av grön vindruva, päron, päroncider och lite äppelmust. Bubblig, förhållandevis stor, torr och oljig kropp. I smaken grön druva, torra vitvinstoner och pigg beska från grönt humle. Även här päron och lite toner från grönt äpple. Bra!
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2016 Taster at the cellar door. Nothing particularly exciting in the flavour but the tight champagne style bubbles give it a wonderful feel.

Champage yeast, bit more tart Than usual, citric, bready malts.
Golden colour, medium white head, lacing.
Medium bite, noticably sweet, bit boozy.
Medium body, soft carbonation, sweetish finish.

Smells great, Nelson Sauvin always has a great aroma, fruity, flora, over ripe, there is a hint of malt in there and some white wine.
Slightly cloudy with a huge head that eventually settles to almost nothing with minimal speckles of lacing if any.
The taste...is just too much. Bitter, aggressively so, it is an attack that doesnt let up and is steady and brutal with every sip. Almost medicinal like an Anticol. Slightly brut champagne, but any of that that is over powered by the relentless almost cloying, pine needle, tree sap assault.
Im not sure what to say about this. It is too overpowered with senseless bitterness.

Burk från SB. Del i mixpack. Gyllengul, disig, högt vitt skum. Först en lätt sötma som släpper fram fina fruktiga smaker av gröna druvor, aprikos och söta krusbär sedan tar en ganska kärv gräsig beska vid och smakbilden blir riktigt torr och krispig. De båda karaktärerna funkar riktigt bra ihop. Snygg fruktig lager som släpper fram NZ-humlen fint.

Aroma is loaded with Nelson hops, and with that a shitload of gooseberry notes and slightly white grape sensations. I really love Nelson hops, and could hardly restrain myself. Also faint notes of straw and hay. Taste starts out great, with just white wine, lemon and crisp malty. Its when the bitterness kicks in the whole thing starts to go downhill. A really bitey and almost harsh bitterness that crashes with the first tastenotes head first. Its drinkable alright, but I think the two dimensional taste dont really play well together. This one could have been a lot more tastier with a more soft finish.

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Burk från SB. Disigt, gyllengul med tjock vit skumkrona. Doft av gräs, passionsfrukt och lite citrus. Lätt, mediumtorr kropp med lite bitter avslutning. Smak av citrus- zest, gräs, gröna druvor och tydlig pilsnermalt.
Strong gooseberry/sauvignon blanc aroma. Taste is loads of gooseberry, almost over the top.

330ml can poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is clear pale yellow with a large frothy beige head. Aroma of lemon zest, grass and a hint of herbs. Flavours of lemon zest and a hint of peaches and spices. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Palate is medium bodied, smooth texture and average carbonation.

@ Havregatan 20160614. Can (330 ml) from Systembolaget. Fruity, hoppy and (champagne) yeasty with citrusy notes, sweet, crisp, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, sweet, yeasty and fruity.

330ml can. Clear golden with one finger white head. Aroma of lemon, white grapes, clear champagne yeast notes, green apples, citrus and melon. Taste is lemon, white grapes, green apples, champagne yeast, grapefruit and faint melon. Light to medium mouthfeel with a dry pleassant bitterness, light carbonation and dry and bitter but simultaneously fruity aftertaste.

Can from SB Torslanda cons. 2016-06-12 Göteborg
AR: lemon flesh, sour grapefruit, 
AP: wee hazy golden, frothy chemical white foam
F: lemon flesh, grapefruit bitternees, strong alcholic, fizzy,
Can. A golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of hops, citrus fruits, and malt. The flavor is malt, citrus fruits, hops, and straw, leading to a bitter finish.

Burk från SB. granskott, smak och doft av humle, jäst, gröna druvor, granskott, gräs med toner av grapefrukt, citrus och äpple eller kan det vara persika? Rund och len, fin sötma, oljig, välbalanserad med rena smaker, fin beska. Mycket uppfriskande!

Can from a mixpack bought at SB.
Only slight hazy golden with a three finger head.
Floral zest citrus aroma with grains and biscuit, grass and carambola.
Taste is fairly dry and floral hoppy with grass, carambola and peach, grains and biscuit. Marked bitter finish.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, oily texture.
A quite nice hoppy lager. More balanced than the other lager in the mixpack.

Ljus med funk i doften. Nä, inget vidare alls obehaglig doft och smak som inte är bra. Vaskas

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Canned from Systembolaget
Golden with a white head. 
Malty, cereal, slightly vinous arma with some marzipan. 
Soft and smooth palate. 
Malty flavour with grassy hops.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, grass, fruit and bitterness.
UPDATED: JUN 11, 2016 330ml Can - Pale golden with a slight haze and a white head. Gooseberries, grapefruit and bubblegum in the aroma. Grain, grapefruit, bubblegum and biscuity malt in the taste.
Sample from 33 cl. can. Clear, pale golden colour with a thin, white head. Fruity aroma with grasses, exotic fruits, citrus. Taste is bitter. Medium bodied. Finishes dry and bitter. Lovely.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - golden pour with white head. Fruity and light malty, some notes of lemon, peach, fruity and light, easy going and easy drinking below the abv, nice.
33 cl can. Pours clear and golden yellow with a white head. Aroma is smooth fruity and light herbal hoppy. Crisp hoppy, peachy and slight grapefruity finish.
33 cl bottle from systembolaget. Pours golden with big head. Fruity grassy aroma with citrus zesty taste.
Golden straw color, white head. Fruity nose, melon, malty, citrus, minerals. Yeast taste, malty, lemon, light bitterness, earthy notes. Medium body, soft to average carbonation.

Can. Hazy gold with a large white head. Aroma of gooseberries, grass, oranges, green mango crackers. Really nice. But then its a muddle of juicy and zesty flavours with some green vegetable notes. Citrus and solvent finish. Yeah, heightens the contradictions.

Pours clear light yellow with a low white head. Aromas of kiwi, citrus, orange jam, mango. Taste is citrusy with fruity and floral notes with slightly bready flavor. Mouthfeel quite smooth with moderate carbonation.

On tap at The Local Melbourne, pours a hazy pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma brings out lots of grassy notes and light straw. Flavour brings out fresh grassy notes and straw. Pretty fresh with lots of grass and dry biscuity notes. Really nice.
Can at Örebro Ölcafé. Fruity malty and bready smell. A fruity yeasty aroma that made me think of champagne. Similar taste. Nice and refreshing.

Keg @ The Bishops Arms Hornsgatan. Slightly hazy, straw-golden, white medium size head, rich lacing. Yeasty aroma, bread, dough, grass, also fruity, grapes and peach. Mild carbonated, clean, crisp and oily mouthfeel. Fresh fruity taste, red apple, ripe grapes, passion fruit, bread, yeast and mild floral bitterness.

Can at Hopyard, Oslo. Clear pale golden beer with a medium offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, white grapes, citrus, peach and some bread. Hoppy citrus flavor with notes of hay and herbs. Really good for a lager.

(Bouteille provenant dEverson Royce): Superbe mousse, sans surprise, avec des notes sulfureuse et juteuse qui sen dégagent. Les houblons sont verts et leurs astringences se joignent à celle de la levure pour atteindre une astringence pointue. Laspect fruité/juteux/céréalier fini par équilibré le tout, très divertissant.

Burk bishops Örebro. Gyllengul kulör med vitt skum. Fruktig och smått vinös doft. Ljust bröd och äpplekart. Frisk och örtig smak. Äpple och hö. spritsig munkänsla med lite syra och smått torr avslutning.
Can pour. Very interesting aroma which leaves me thinking of champagne and hops at the same time. Hidden bitter depths with the mellow pilsner yeast on top. Fantasticly simply and session able

How: Draught.
Where: BrewDog Kungsholmen, Stockholm.
Appearance: Clear light yellow colour with a small white head.
Aroma: Malt, vegetables, some hops, citrus, pine.
Body: Light body, medoim carbonation.
Flavour: Vegetables, malt, floral, tropical fruit.
Sort of hazy dull tan. Thick head. Big rich hop nose, touch yeasty, lots of pear, gooseberry bitterness. Nice brew, dryish, slightly alcoholic IPA.
650ml bottle poured a fine pale gold with a lasting frothy head & a hoppy aroma the taste is complex bitter carbonated hops citrus fruity herbs yeast loads of flavour & a bitter lingering finish
KØLF 030715. Golden-yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, hop, pine, grapefruit. Flavour is fruit, malt, hop, pine, grapefruit, tropical fruit, yeast. Medium body. OK beer.

330 ml can bought at Little Beer Shop in SoHo, Central.
Looks: Cloudy hazy golden honey with faint trace of yeast hazeone and a half finger head and crumpety white foam which lasts for 3 mniutes; Beautiful sticky lacing with near zero carbonation.

Aroma: Fragrant full Pils malt, with strong passion fruits, raw grapes, yellow fruits, notes of grapefruits, floral, molasses, biscuits, yeast, lemon and thin grass.

Taste: Mid to light sweet Pils malt, with light passion fruits, light honey, molasses, dry biscuits, yeast, strong lemon, strong bitter hops and sharp grass.

Body: Close to medium body. Dry and slightly creamy palate.

Mouth Feel: Very good Pils maltyness in somewhat thin but very smooth background. Nelson Sauvin dominates with unassuming passionfruits, honey and lemon. Strong bitterness is well balanced by subtle sweetness. Lovely!

Hoppiness: Strong passion fruits, raw grapes, yellow fruits, notes of grapefruits, floral, and lemon in nose. Light passion fruits, molasses, strong lemon and sharp grass I taste; Bitterness is intense but pleasant for a lasting, high astringent bitter-sweet finish.

After Taste: Dry. Fruity, creamy and nicely bitter to mouth.

Comments: After the Pils and Thrills, things can only get better with this Imperial Pils and I was right: excellent heads with wine yeast, solid Pils maltyness, and Nelson Sauvin with good aroma and taste. Well rounded with lovable bitter and sweet balance. Almost perfect!
Tap at Bitter phew. Cloudy Amber, white lace. Super fresh citric, ginger like hops, flowery and vinous notes. Sparkly, fun. Nice one.
On tap at SBWF15. Clear golden with white head. Aroma has malt, biscuit, grass, hay, bread and earth. Taste is fairly dry, bread, floral, grain, biscuit and earth.

Keg at BrewDog Kungsholmen, Stockholm.  Clear pale golden, small head. Luscious hop aroma with white currant. gooseberry and passionfruit. Mid sweet with light-medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Grainy with lots of tropical fruits. Mid bitter finish. Excellent NZ hops!

Draught at Brewdog Kungsholmen, Stockholm. Clear pale golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Malty caramel aroma, grassy, grapes, citrus, peach, pine apples, some bread. Hoppy citrus flavor, grassy, hay, floral, herbal, some caramel. Nice lager.

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2015 Draught. Clear golden liquid with small white head. Aroma of malt, bread, flowers, apples and earth. Taste is light sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of bread, light floral hops and grain. Light to medium bodied withedoum to high carbonation. Nice and bright.

Draught @ Beer Deluxe, Fed Square
Pale gold, holds a good creamy head.
Prominent hop nose; citrus rind, passionfruit, guava, grass, a touch of pale pilsener malt toastiness.
Med-full body, resiny, not sure of its strength but it feels pretty big!
Delivers a good measure of hops on the body; passionfruit, citrus rind, grass, melon, bitterness seems a bit subdued at first but builds.
Imperial pilsener? Full on but enjoy the hop character.

Bottle shared by esp0r november 29th 2014. Golden body with a thick white head. Aroma is sweet orange jam with a slight alcohol burn, taste is floral with earthy hops, pineapple and herbs. Grassy aftertaste with a high bitterness.

Color: Straw yellow with lasting white foam.
Aroma: Pungent and moderately funky passion fruit, white grapefruit and yeast.
Palate: Very fine soft, carbonated attack
Flavor: Fine bubbly, passion fruit and grain. Finishes with a pungent passion fruit and white grapefruit rind that gains intensity as does a lingering grass and pine bitterness that overtakes the grapefruit bitterness.
Comment:

From Bottle Shop, drank after HKUST visit. Beautiful bright hazy golden pour with big fluffy white head and foamy legs. Smells of Nelson Sauvin hop - plenty of grape as well as mango and peach, woody. Biscuity lightly spiced malt too. Taste is wood chip floral hop, dry grape and mineral. Body is smooth, very fine carbonation (from the champagne yeast). Very interesting, fine and refreshing. Slick, fruity (grape + citrus), woody, fizzy.

Bottle from Bottle Shop at home. Bright golden slightly hazy translucent pour with foamy white head. Vertical strips of bubbles like champagne. Looks great. Aroma is fresh crisp pilsner hoppiness. Taste is really clean - fresh hoppiness, smooth slightly sweet malts, crisp champagne carbonation. Lingering pilsner bitterness. The best version of what I'd imagined/hoped after reading the description. Would definitely get again.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of floral notes, white wine, fruitiness and yeast. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some white wine, malt and tropical fruits. Medium body, average carbonation.

Clear golden body with a white head. Strong hoppy aroma of tropical fruits. Strong flavour of tropical fruits, with distinct notes of mango. Light sweet taste with a moderate to heavy bitter finish. Medium to light body, dry, quite lively carbonation. An unusually hopped lager! 
[65 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag, from Vinmonopolet Online]

Bottle from Vinmonopolet, Kvadrat. Pours hazy straw colored with a small creamy snow white head.Weak grassy hop aroma, some exotic fruits. Taste is light sweet plum and grain, dry fruity hops dries it out towards the short end, enjoyable and refreshing.

65cl bottle shared by Arve_Christian, thanks a lot! Pours slightly hazy golden with a nice, white head. Lovely hoppy aroma with citrus, fruity notes, pale malt and hints of yeast and herbs. Moderate sweet with nice fruity flavours and a decent bitterness. Tasty stuff!

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Hasle. Golden hazy color, ok foam. Medium aroma intensity; hops, grassy, citrus. Good bitterness & balance. Very enjoyable 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
- Short review- Fruity, crisp and dry. Balanced white grapes with champagne yeast. Nothing special.
22oz bottle pours a pale straw color with a bit of frothy head. Nice hop profile but a little sweet. Fruity.

Pours a mostly clear light gold with pillowy white head. Big hop aroma, while very pleasant, overshadows the pils malts. Catty hops, rather than tropical fruits as on the label. Crisp, bitter hop flavor. Ahh, here are the tropical fruits: mango. Along with some grapefruit zest and pith. Dry finish with a lingering bitterness. This could get me to the ballet.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy yellow body with a medium creamy white head. Nose is grass, kiwi, grapefruit, straw, citric peel and hints of catty herbs, pale malts and tomato plant. Taste is dry citric peel tones, champagne yeast, pale malts, catty herbs, mild red fruits and hints of resin and straw. Medium body, crisp and dry finish. A bit too much on the bitter side for me; the citric-pale malts-champagne yeast combination doesnt really work on my palate and the Nelson hop additions does nothing to relieve the feeling. I can see where this beer wants to go, but I dont want to follow.

Bottle from Vika shared at dajes place
Golden hazy, thin white head. Smell of sauvignon blanc grapes,hint of citrus, light malts, fruits and spices. Moderate sweet, quite fruity, some grapes and apple, quite herbal. Moderate bitter finish, alot of resins. Nice lager!

It is what it is really. Yellow gold in colour with a tinge of haze and a coarse white head. A nose full of lime and yellow grapefruit peel with just a hint of sour juiciness reflected in the flavour. Its a tasty, elegant thing with some real steel to its flavour. Some real tartness there, like the tears of a failed ballerina.
Good easy drinking beer, malt upfront on the pallet with a clean and crisp finish to make this an enjoyable experience. Well worth the test.

Bouteille de 650 ml partagé lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Légère odeur de fruits tropicaux. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Léger goût de fruits de la passion avec une pointe de miel et dagrumes. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement minérale. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence dagrumes en arrière goût. (Rating #5827)

500 ml bottle. Pours golden with good white head. Lines of bubbles. Aroma is fruity, crisp with hints of baking soda, very winey hop aroma, distinctive yeasty aromas as well. Taste is very much like wine. Bitter dry sweet aftertaste.

BOTTLE. Shared, straw colour with small bubbly head. Honey & banana on the nose with a small sent of cork. Sweet almost wine profile with a honey lemon crisp sweet finish.
Sourced form Cellarbrations Capel

Aroma of grapefruit and ice wine grapes, lime rind, with a squirt of skunk. Flavour is hoppy bitter, a bit grassy, but still balanced with the same fruits as on the aroma (except the mustelid). Very creamy palate, nice for this lager. Nothing too exciting about the appearance, lemony gold with a creamy white head. Really much better than the average lager. I could drink more of this.

Went into this without reading description. Obvious skanky nelson Sauvin on the nose. Pale light base malt colouring. Pillowy foamy white head. Flavour is similar to nose enjoyable, boozy. Small amount of bitterness. Almost Saison like but without the spice. A beautiful well crafted beer, but I could really only drink the one and saviour that flavour.

Clear highly carbonated poor with fizzy white head. Pungent hops from start to Finnish. Tropical passion fruit - great kiwi hop flavour. Nice difference the highly hoped lager from the ale was that it seemed light not overly filling then again might have just been because it was the first beer of the day.

Pours a golden straw color with foamy off white head. Nose is approachable. Floral, some passionfruit, slightly spicy phenolic aroma, a tiny bit of orange marmalade. Flavor is pretty similar. Passionfruit, a little spice, slightly sweet marmalade note, lightl bitter finish. Very focussed, with a light body, fine carbonation and moderately long finish. The yeast character in this is really the star. The phenols and the slightly marmaladey sweet note taste very Belgian and they make this much more than a premium lager. Interesting for sure.
Excellent lager from the Aro Garage. Resiny floral herby aroma due to mega amounts of hops. Nice medium white head and golden coloured beer. medium bitter taste, crisp finish

UPDATED: JUN 18, 2016 Restrained tropical fruit aroma in a golden pour. An excellent lager that would make an ale drinker happy. Clean taste somehow remains complex (and that is not the brew talking). Probably better than my initial rating indicates - will endeavour to try again and update as required.

An unfiltered, sparkling, strong golden lager which has undergone secondary fermentation with Champagne yeast. From the bright tank it was highly gassy with a billowy white head. Champagne yeast is immediately evident with a strong calcium minerality and bright phenol profile, its airy, dusty, earthy but clean with developing floral perfume character. Wonderfully clean with high carbonation, soft malt texture, medium sweetness, medium bitterness with a rich, filling mouth feel.  Nelson hops giving it that obligatory Sauvignon Blanc fruitiness with softer touches of dried grass and herbs. Well-made and interesting but novel; likable in small amounts.
Nice colour and aroma, head retention is decent. Flavour has hints of tropical fruit, particularly pineapple. Palate is quite dry but has a lovely fizz. Overall a very nice drop.

Delicious. From the aroma you know exactly what youre getting. Floral, spicy, lemon, grapefruit, grass, hay. Hop-forward with a nice clean bitterness, this delicious fact does tend to emphasize the light(-ish) lager body. A little under-carbonated, maybe. Maybe. My bottle was gone before you could say a one syllable word.
The head is good, the body blond. It smells malty, yeasty, hoppy. The taste is dry-malty, special yeasty, bitter-dry, hoparomatic, nice! 3.7

Blocky head medium strong carbonation pale gold pour aromas fruity grape tropical citrus the flavours passionfruit mango pine smooth bitter medium type grapefruit the finish nice tasting ale good hoppy tastes lasting bitter yeast taste nice ale

Pours gold with a large, fading head.
Nose shows spicy and floral hops along with some grassy notes and a little soft malt.
Flavours include grainy malt, spicy and herbal hops and a very faint passion fruit note. Quite an aggressive sharp bitterness in the finish.
Needs more carbonation.
I kind of liked this beer. It was a little less in your face than the pilsnthrills and a little more balanced.

Bottle from Slowbeer. Bright, slightly hazy golden, really lively, fresh flavours and aromas, gassy/piney/citrusy/tangy hops, some nice malty notes topped off with a mild yeast presence. A really nice beer, loved it.

Pours a golden yellow with creamy head. Medium carbonation, thought it may be more spritzy. Taste is dry, reminiscent of a fresh Duvel. Tastes like a Belgian, I guess champagne yeast is similar. Lemony zest from the Sauvin hops. Classy beer, I like it a lot.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours clear yellow with a small, very firm white head which lats for the duration. Nose shows a heap of tangy lemon hops and biscuit. Taste shows heavy citrus and tangy lemon. Balanced. Spritzy carbonation. Fair bit of heat at the end. Ok

Pale golden with sml head. Smells.. Are not strong like an ipa, but a good sense of hoppy citrus and partiularly grapefruit, lager malts and a little grassy too. Tastes.. Real controlled fruity hops with a lager malt and bitterness presence. Nz water is pure & crisp. Great for a lager.

UPDATED: JUN 21, 2015 Okay, lager isnt my thing but this is something good - I reckon the folks at GP HQ have tinkered with the recipe cos my previous revue was pretty average - this current version is so clean, so proper and so, um, Germanic! Great noble hops edge and a steely-ness that cuts right through. I might actually be enjoying this lager!

I like this more than I thought I would,. There is a goodly hoppiness that does not carry a rough finish. Its light and carries its flavours well.  Im enjoying so much more than I thought I would. Compared to other commercial lagers this is a head and shoulders above that.  As it warms though the hops take control and it moves away from being a premium lager, to a strong hopped beer. A bit good, but not a bit great

UPDATED: OCT 11, 2015 Delicate like a ballet dancer this lager has a nice sweet hopped nose.  Pours a pale colour and unfortunately is lacking in depth on the palate.  The flavours are there but it just feels a little thin and watery. Overall 3.1

RERATE: Heard reports this beer has been on the improve and looks like they were right. Flavours are more persistent and not as sweet as before
